free: #e Nice to see you.
#c 你好。
#e I am going to tell an ancient story.
#c 我要談論很久以前的故事.
#e Long time ago, there was a hunter.
#c 很久以前，說是有個獵人。
#e The hunter who hunted with a dog became a bird named Dut.
#c 帶狗狩獵的獵人變成一隻叫做Duut的鳥。
#e Long time a ago, there was a greatly brave hunter.
#c 很久以前，說是有一個很厲害的專業獵人。
#e One day, he was with his dog.
#c 有一天，他帶著他的狗。
#e It is because when hunting with a dog, a brave dog is required to help hunters chase the game.
#c 是因為狩獵的時候必須有很厲害的狗幫人追逐野生動物。
#e There was a brave man who was never left behind when going dog-hunting with others.
#c 有一個很勇敢的人，他和其他人一起帶狗狩獵的時候，絕對不輸別人
#n pasavai 比賽、savai-an 輸（比賽）、palavai-un 落後（工作等等的）
#e When hunting, he caught preys the most.
#c 打獵時，他獵得最多。
#e He was able to get more game because he was excellent.
#c 他可以獵得比較多因為他很會。
#n aiza-an=ik (mas) asu
#n ma’muav < masmuav
#e He has a treasured dog that is pretty good at chasing, chasing deers and pigs.
#c 他有一隻非常地會獵補愛的愛狗，獵水鹿，獵山豬。
#e One day, this person who is called Talum the Brave went hunting. When he was at it, he brought his dog because he was going to go dog hunting.
#c 然後，有一天，這一個叫作勇敢的Talum的人，他去打獵，順便帶狗去打獵因為要順便用狗打獵。
#e So much game is shot.
#c 獵過非常多的獵物了。
#n pinanah 感覺是受焦的過去式，也就是說<in>中綴的零形就是受焦！

gloss: 重疊-整理-受焦=改變狀態
非實現=主焦-去-路=改變狀態
free: #e He kept packing the game and was ready to go home.
#c 他一直（把獵物）裝（進網袋）了，要回家了。
#n damus < damu-un mas
#e Once a big wild boar which had not been caught before, passed and was seen by his dog, the dog would not stop chasing those wild animals or wild boars until they were caught.
#c 然後，他的狗，只要看到經過他的大山豬還沒抓到的話，他就不會停止地一直追趕到他把那些動物啊山豬啊抓到為止。

gloss: 人名-主焦-刀鋒=遠距.主格

free: #e Talum the Brave kept packing the large amount of prey he had shot and considered how he could bring this much home.
#c 那個Talum呢，他一直裝一直裝，哇那麼多，他又想說要揹回家了，因為打得太多了。
#n bai: 感嘆（短的）、mikui < mikua 因為
#e However since his dog kept barking while approaching the other side, he knew that the dog was chasing a big wild boar because it barked without stopping.
#c 可是因為他的狗反而愈來愈追到對岸，一直汪汪叫，他知道這隻狗還正在追大山豬呢，因為他還一直在用力的叫。
#n ung hai 是轉折的語氣用法，有點「是啊，可是...」的意思、manadidiip < makanadidiip、 manadidiip tu makazav 愈來愈冷了、uska- < iska- (sia) 到達某個地方（但還不是終點）、lunglung 汪汪叫
#e Then, ‘Tu tu tu tu tu tu,’ the hunter called the dog back.
#c 然後，獵人一直「嘟嘟嘟」地叫狗回來。
#n tutut叫狗的聲音

gloss: 非實現=主焦-去-路=改變狀態

free: #e They would leave if you were back. But the dog was still barking.
#c 回來了他們就要走了，可是那隻狗還在用力地一直汪汪叫。

gloss: 人名=主焦-刀鋒=遠距.主格

free: #e Talum let it go, taking the net bag on his back and left for home.
#c Talum就不管了，背起網袋走回家了
#n masaa 不聽話，硬要作對，偏偏、cisama 背起來
#e While continuing to call the dog, Talum the Brave arrived home.
#c 一邊呼叫著狗的同時，勇敢的Talum不知不覺到了家。
#n dai「來！來！」叫狗的感覺。
#e His dog did not follow him, and did not come back either.
#c 他看到狗沒有跟著他，也沒有跟著回來。
#n kinkinuzan 被跟者
#e After arriving home, he asked his wife and children if the dog had come home in prior?
#c 回到家後，他問他的老婆小孩：「是不是狗已經先回這個家了？」
#n 這裡的saicia應該是isaicia，但是口語上可能會省略。
#e His wife and children answered: ‘NO.’
#c 老婆和小孩回答：「沒有。」
#e Then Talum the brave was considering why the dog did not come after?
#c 然後Talum就在想：「欸，奇怪，怎麼沒有跟來呢？」
#e He remembered that he had heard the dog barking when he was leaving.
#c 他想起來，當他要走的時候還聽到那個狗一直汪汪叫。
#e He put down the meat he had been carrying on his back.
#c 他立刻把他背的獵物放下。
#e He went back to the forest where he had gone dog hunting right away and kept looking for the dog.
#c 他立刻回頭，回到他所狗獵的森林一直找尋。
#e He kept yelling, because he wanted his dog back. He was going to look for his dog.
#c 一直呼喚，要把狗喚回，要去尋找他的狗
#e Because he treasured the dog very much, the brave dog.
#c 因為那是他非常珍惜的狗呢！勇敢的狗。
#e Oh, come on!
#c 欸，真是的！
#n 是Talum的感受，「啊！真是的！」那種感覺
#e Talum the Brave put down his net bag and the meat.
#c 那個勇敢的Talum把所背的袋子和肉放下來。
#e He turned back right away, went back through the night to the hunting ground and kept calling the dog.
#c 立刻馬上回頭，連夜趕到他的獵場，一直叫那隻狗。
#e No, there was no dog being found. There was no dog coming back there.
#c 沒有找到狗，狗沒有回到他的身邊。
#e He kept calling in the mountain despite that the sky turned dark.
#c 然後天變黑了他還在山上叫。
#n saia 指的是Talum，意思是Talum在那邊待到了天黑了、isdumduman saia sia ludum=cia 他還在山上天變黑了
#e However, he could not go back if the dog was not found.
#c 如果沒找到那隻狗他就不回去。
#n inkaduan a asu mas autuk 狗找到兔子。inkaduan=in maza autuk=a 那隻兔子被找到了。mikui可是的意思
#e The day broke.
#c 天亮了。

gloss: 人名=主焦-刀鋒=遠距.主格

free: #e Talum the Brave got on the tree, keeping calling and looking for his dog a whole day. However, no dog came.
#c 勇敢的Talum爬上樹一直叫喚他的狗，邊喊邊找了一整天，但還是沒有狗回來
#e Then he had been in the mountain all day, till the night, till the day after.
#c 然後他一整天到晚上到隔天，他都在山上。
#e Three days passed, the dog that he had been looking for did not come back.
#c 三天三夜了，他找的那隻狗沒有回來。
#e He kept calling, without eating and sleeping. Yet the dog did not come back.
#c 不吃不睡一直叫，一直呼喊那隻狗，但是狗還是沒有回來。

gloss: 人名=主焦-刀鋒=遠距.主格

free: #e Talum the Brave was so sad. He missed the dog very much, the dog he treasured the most.
#c 然後那個Talum很傷心，非常想念那隻狗，他最珍惜的狗

gloss: 非實現=否定.存在=改變狀態
free: #e However, he kept calling and considering what if there is not his brave dog? He would get no help when going hunting.
#c 但是他邊叫邊想：「如果沒有他的勇敢的狗的話要怎麼辦呢？打獵的時候就沒有狗可以幫助他了。」
#e In the tree he became very sad of a sudden, wondering what should he do.
#c 他在樹上突然難過、傷心起來，想著要怎麼辦。
#e Three days passed unconsciously.
#c 不知不覺，原來已經三天了。

gloss: 否定.存在-處焦=改變狀態

free: #e He was hungry and hard and had no power.
#c 很餓很辛苦，身體已經沒有體力沒有力量了。
#e He was weak on the tree, and then he died.
#c 他在樹上，癱軟一倒，斷氣了。
#n is-uka=s < is-uka-an mas   斷氣了。
#n us=in a < is=in a < isa=in a
#e After three days passed, his wife wondered where Talum the Brave was, why not come back home after looking for dog for three days.
#c 過了三天他的老婆找說「勇敢的Talum在哪裡了？一直找那個狗，三天了還沒回家。」
#e She brought his children, and told her neighboring cousins: ‘Follow us to look for him. My husband had been out of connection for three days since he went looking for the dog. What should I do?’
#c 她帶著孩子，並請求隔壁的親戚說：「跟著我去找，要怎麼辦我的丈夫已不見三天了，離開去找狗都沒回來。」
#n tas’an 直系兄弟姊妹、tais’an 旁系兄弟姊妹、239. 我們一起去找
#e Then indeed the cousins went to the mountain where Talum usually goes to.
#c 果然真的有親戚緊跟著朝著Talum常常去的打獵的山。
#n una’uun 常去的地方、una’u-un=ku huma a 我常去的田
#e Those people and his wife and children were also there and kept calling: ‘Talum, where are you? Talum the brave, where are you?’
#c 他們那些人、太太和孩子也在那邊一直叫：「Talum你在哪裡？勇敢的Talum你在哪？」
#e No answers thought.
#c 都沒回應。
#e They went uphill. They looked up, seeing something kept crying ‘duduut’ in the tree.
#c 一直往上走爬到山上，抬頭望上看有什麼在樹上嘟嘟叫。
#n palmanghaun 把他的頭向上、259的man-是前綴，用口出聲
#e Then they looked upward and wondered what was crying ‘Duduut’.
#c 他們再望上看，到底是什麼在樹上一直嘟嘟叫。
#e Oh! They saw a big bird kept crying ‘DUDUUT’ on the branch.
#c 哎！看到有一隻鳥，很大的鳥在樹枝上就一直嘟嘟叫。
#e Duut duut.
#c 嘟嘟。
#e In fact, they saw, and all of a sudden the knew that was a bird Talum the Brave had become.
#c 原來如此，他們看見，然後他們就知道那個他原來就是勇敢的Talum變成鳥了。
#n hangsia < amuhangsia < amushangsia 都是原來如此的意思、278. sia「就是」的意思、#n sia=s < sia=mas
#e He just became this bird that was crying ‘Duduut'.
#c 就變成了現在一直嘟嘟叫的鳥。

#e As for this bird, since the man missed and cherished his dog very much, and he could not find it although he kept looking for it, without eating and sleeping for three days, he was too sad and then became a bird.
#c 這隻鳥，就這樣，因為這個太想念、太疼愛他的狗了，一直找但一直找不到，三天不吃不睡，心裡苦，這個人就變成鳥。
#n a=sain < maza=sain 這、maza=saia 那個 也可以唸 maza=sia、 286.這句多講了
#n it-sauhzang mataz 因為餓死掉
#e Because he died from limping on the tree, he became a bird that is called Duut now.
#c 因為這樣癱死在樹上，所以變成鳥，現在叫做 Duut。
#e The end.
#c 結束。
